titles.title: A bill to extend the limited antitrust exemption contained in the Pandemic and All-Hazards Preparedness Act.

vote.text: Introduced in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

term.name: Emergency medical services and trauma care

bill.summary: 12/30/2012--Passed Senate without amendment. Extends for one year the limited antitrust exemption under the Pandemic and All-Hazards Preparedness Act for participating in meetings and consultations to discuss security countermeasures, qualified countermeasures, or qualified pandemic or epidemic product development.
